panels.description: Current state of Powerwall operation, either "running" or "stopped".
panels.title: Operation

panels.description: Powerwall State of Energy.  This value is expressed as a percentage of full charge across all Powerwall units in the system. It may report slightly higher than the corresponding value in the Tesla mobile app.
panels.title: Powerwall SOE

panels.description: Current battery charge/discharge state. This corresponds to the Powerwall system state at the top of the main Powerwall screen on the Tesla mobile app.
panels.title: PW State

panels.description: Instantaneous site power. Positive values indicate feeding from the grid. Negative values indicate backfeed to the grid.
panels.title: Grid (Site)

panels.description: Instantaneous solar production. This value is always positive.
panels.title: Solar

panels.description: Instantaneous load. This value is always positive.
panels.title: Home (Load)

panels.description: Current state of the grid connection.  "Up" is the nominal state.  "Down" means a loss of grid connection and indicates the Powerwall system is providing power to the site.  "In Recovery" indicates recent restoration of the grid connection and that the Powerwall system is resynchronizing.
panels.title: Grid Connection

panels.description: State of network connection to Tesla backend servers.
panels.title: Tesla Connection

panels.description: Energy supplied by grid over this time period.
panels.title: From Grid

panels.description: Energy supplied by battery over this time period.
panels.title: From PW

panels.description: Solar energy production over this time period.
panels.title: Solar

panels.description: Home energy usage over this time period.
panels.title: Home

panels.description: Current solar inverter MPPT states.
panels.title: MPPT State

panels.description: Instant voltage from Powerwall site meter (nominal 240V +/- 5%).
panels.title: Site Voltage

panels.description: Instantaneous battery power. Positive values indicate discharge to load. Negative values indicate charging from solar or grid.
panels.title: Powerwall

panels.description: AC line frequency, 60.0 Hz is nominal.  The Powerwall system may increase the AC line frequency beyond nominal if necessary to curtail solar production.  The cutoff frequency for this installation is 60.5 Hz.
panels.title: AC Frequency

panels.description: Grid connection state.  "Feed" indicates power is being delivered from the grid to the site.  "Backfeed" indicates power is being sent back to the grid (presumably from solar).  "Standby" means that no significant power is being transferred to or from the grid.
panels.title: Grid State

panels.description: Current solar inverter state.
panels.title: Solar State

panels.description: Energy backfed to grid over this time period.
panels.title: To Grid

panels.description: Energy used to charge battery over this time period.
panels.title: To PW

panels.description: Historical value of power meters and battery state of energy.

targets.query: SELECT mean("soe") FROM "autogen"."powerwall" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Powerwall Meters

panels.description: Historical value of power produced by each MPPT of the Powerwall+ solar inverter.

targets.query: SELECT mean("soe") FROM "autogen"."powerwall" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Powerwall+ Inverter MPPTs

panels.description: Historical value of power produced by each MPPT of the Powerwall+ solar inverter.

targets.query: SELECT mean("soe") FROM "autogen"."powerwall" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Powerwall+ Inverter MPPTs

panels.description: Current state of the grid connection.  "Up" is the nominal state.  "Down" means a loss of grid connection and indicates the Powerwall system is providing power to the site.  "In Recovery" indicates recent restoration of the grid connection and that the Powerwall system is resynchronizing.
panels.title: Grid

panels.description: Grid power flow state.  "Feed" indicates power is being delivered from the grid to the site.  "Backfeed" indicates power is being sent back to the grid (presumably from solar).  "Standby" means that no significant power is being transferred to or from the grid.
panels.title: Grid Flow

panels.description: State of network connection to Tesla backend servers.
panels.title: Network
